Title: Building a quick Reddit Blazor client without Reddit's API
Description: Learn how to build a simple Reddit client with Blazor and the pushshift.io API. Pull conversations and statistics from Reddit with a few lines.

Title: Distributed systems evolution: message contracts
Description: Evolving distributed systems architecture is challenging. If the system is message-based, the first challenge comes from evolving message contracts.

Title: How Stack Overflow is leveling up its unit testing game
Description: We neglected unit tests for a long time because our code base made them difficult. But now we're putting in the work to change that.

Title: Get and Put State
Description: A pair of standard helper functions for the State monad. An article for object-oriented programmers.

Title: I can’t believe that I can prove that it can sort
Description: by Yannick Moy – Jun 23, 2022. When an enthusiastic Ada programmer and a SPARK expert pair up to prove the most "stupid" sorting algorithm, lessons are learned! Join us in this eye-opening journey.

Title: On the use of a life
Description:

Title: Felt – The best way to make maps on the internet
Description: Felt lets you create maps collaboratively, using world-class data, and share them in a single click. For team projects or epic adventure with friends.

Title: Site Reliability Engineering – More Evolution of Automation
Description: We're going back in time, or is it forward?, as we continue learning about Google's automation evolution, while Allen doesn't like certain beers, Joe is a Zacker™, and Michael poorly assumes that UPSes work best when plugged in.

Title: Tiny Core Linux 13.0 is a full Linux desktop in 22 MB #Linux
Description: Most Linux-based operating systems are fairly large — usually well over a full gigabyte in size for the base install image. Tiny Core Linux, which clocks in at a svelte 22 MB download, just release…
